definition: see 出其不意，攻其不備|出其不意，攻其不备[chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4]
to attack/to accuse/to study
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
not to have/no/none/not/to lack/un-/-less
variant of 備|备[bei4]
to prepare/get ready/to provide or equip
see 出其不意，攻其不備|出其不意，攻其不备[chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4]
to catch an enemy off guard with a surprise attack (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
pinyin: chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4

definition: to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
to defeat the enemy by capturing their chief (idiom)
lit. to besiege 魏[Wei4] and rescue 趙|赵[Zhao4] (idiom)/fig. to relieve a besieged ally by attacking the home base of the besiegers
to win by a surprise move
to lure the tiger from its domain in the mountains (idiom)/to lure an enemy away from his territory
to do sth when least expected (idiom); to catch sb off guard
unexpectedly/unawareness/unpreparedness
to wait at one's ease for the exhausted enemy/to nurture one's strength and bide one's time (idiom)
lit. to pull a snake from its hole/to expose a malefactor (idiom)
to face the enemy/to meet an attack
(idiom) stay clear of the enemy's main force and strike at his weak points
lit. speed is a crucial asset in war (idiom)/fig. swift and resolute (in doing sth)
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
to win without a fight (idiom)
